info.name: VectorEllipse
info.comment: Extends the Vector class with support for elliptical path generation.

description.p: The VectorEllipse class provides the necessary functionality for elliptical path generation.

field.name: CenterX
field.comment: The horizontal center of the ellipse. Expressed as a fixed or scaled coordinate.

description.p: The horizontal center of the ellipse is defined here as either a fixed or scaled value.

field.name: CenterY
field.comment: The vertical center of the ellipse. Expressed as a fixed or scaled coordinate.

description.p: The vertical center of the ellipse is defined here as either a fixed or scaled value.

field.name: Dimensions
field.comment: Dimension flags define whether individual dimension fields contain fixed or relative values.

description.p: The following dimension flags are supported:

types.type: The RadiusX value is a fixed coordinate.
The RadiusY value is a fixed coordinate.
The CenterX value is a fixed coordinate.
The CenterY value is a fixed coordinate.
The RadiusX value is a scaled coordinate.
The RadiusY value is a scaled coordinate.
The CenterX value is a scaled coordinate.
The CenterY value is a scaled coordinate.

field.name: Height
field.comment: The height (vertical diameter) of the ellipse.

description.p: The height of the ellipse is defined here as the equivalent of RadiusY * 2.0.

field.name: Radius
field.comment: The radius of the ellipse. Expressed as a fixed or scaled coordinate.

description.p: The radius of the ellipse is defined here as either a fixed or scaled value. Updating the radius will set both the RadiusX and RadiusY values simultaneously.

field.name: RadiusX
field.comment: The horizontal radius of the ellipse.

description.p: The horizontal radius of the ellipse is defined here as either a fixed or scaled value.

field.name: RadiusY
field.comment: The vertical radius of the ellipse.

description.p: The vertical radius of the ellipse is defined here as either a fixed or scaled value.

field.name: Vertices
field.comment: Limits the total number of vertices generated for the ellipse.

description.p: Setting a value in Vertices will limit the total number of vertices that are generated for the ellipse. This feature is useful for generating common convex geometrical shapes such as triangles, polygons, hexagons and so forth; because their vertices will always touch the sides of an elliptical area.
Please note that this feature is not part of the SVG standard.

field.name: Width
field.comment: The width (horizontal diameter) of the ellipse.

description.p: The width of the ellipse is defined here as the equivalent of RadiusX * 2.0.
